intro: Roptrostemon concolor, commonly known as the smoothleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are smooth and glossy. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
